result.execSummary:
The defendant Ann Marie Esselman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution has been paid in full and is to be paid out to victim.
*All costs have been paid in full and will be applied.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ann Marie Esselman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's copy of JOC returned undeliverable - Unable to Forward per USPS
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Ann Marie Esselman in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that in speaking with the defendant; the matter is resolved.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement. Atty Hendee states that the Restitution has been paid in full and asks that the COC office pay that out.
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney and would like to proceed today.  
Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Restitution + surcharge
  COC office to pay out Restitution.

Pre-trial conference at 03-08-2016 09:00 am.
Return date at 04-06-2016 03:30 pm.

Defendant Ann Marie Esselman in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant would like to speak with the DA.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.
  Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

BY THE COURT:  Reset Return and set Pre-Trial.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.

with conditions:
*No contact with Natasha Vastain or the residence at 231 S. State St., Neshkoro, WI
*Defendant will be allowed one time with Law Enforcement to get her belongings

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant wants to get counsel.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return

Defendant Ann Marie Esselman in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*No contact with Natasha Vastain or the residence at 231 S. State St., Neshkoro, WI
*Defendant will be allowed one time with Law Enforcement to get her belongings  Return date scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
